# scm_service_route (Resource)

ServiceRoute resource

## Example Usage

```terraform
resource "scm_ethernet_interface" "sr_ethernet_interface_1" {
  name        = "$layer3_sr_1"
  comment     = "Managed by Terraform"
  folder      = "ngfw-shared"
  link_speed  = "auto"
  link_duplex = "full"
  link_state  = "auto"
  layer3 = {
    ip = [
      {
        name = "10.10.10.10"
      }
    ]
  }
}

resource "scm_ethernet_interface" "sr_ethernet_interface_2" {
  name        = "$layer3_sr_2"
  comment     = "Managed by Terraform"
  folder      = "ngfw-shared"
  link_speed  = "auto"
  link_duplex = "full"
  link_state  = "auto"
  layer3 = {
    ip = [
      {
        name = "10.10.10.20"
      }
    ]
  }
}

resource "scm_service_route" "sr_settings" {
  folder = "ngfw-shared"
  route = {
    service = [
      {
        name = "ddns"
        source = {
          interface = scm_ethernet_interface.sr_ethernet_interface_1.name
          address   = "10.10.10.10"
        }
      }
    ]
    destination = [
      {
        name = scm_ethernet_interface.sr_ethernet_interface_2.name,
        source = {
          address = "10.10.10.20"
        }
      }
    ]
  }
}
```

## Schema

### Optional

- `device` (String) The device in which the resource is defined

> ℹ️ **Note:** You must specify exactly one of `device`, `folder`, and `snippet`.
- `folder` (String) The folder in which the resource is defined

> ℹ️ **Note:** You must specify exactly one of `device`, `folder`, and `snippet`.
- `route` (Attributes) Route (see [below for nested schema](#nestedatt--route))
- `snippet` (String) The snippet in which the resource is defined

> ℹ️ **Note:** You must specify exactly one of `device`, `folder`, and `snippet`.

### Read-Only

- `id` (String) UUID of the resource
- `tfid` (String) The Terraform ID.

### Nested Schema for `route.destination.source`

Optional:

- `address` (String) Address
- `interface` (String) Interface



<a id="nestedatt--route--service"></a>
### Nested Schema for `route.service`

Optional:

- `name` (String) The follow list details the accepted `name` values and their corresponding service description.
- `autofocus` = AutoFocus Cloud
- `crl-status` = CRL servers
- `data-services` = Data Services
- `ddns` = DDNS server(s)
- `deployments` = Panorama pushed updates
- `dns` = DNS server(s)
- `edl-updates` = External Dynamic List update server
- `email` = SMTP gateway(s)
- `hsm` = Hardware Security Module server(s)
- `http` = HTTP Forwarding server(s)
- `iot` = IOT service-route
- `kerberos` = Kerberos server
- `ldap` = LDAP server
- `mdm` = MDM servers
- `mfa` = Multi-Factor Authentication
- `netflow` = Netflow server(s)
- `ntp` = NTP server(s)
- `paloalto-networks-services` = Palo Alto Networks Services
- `panorama` = Panorama server
- `panorama-log-forwarding` = Panorama Log Forwarding
- `proxy` = Proxy server
- `radius` = RADIUS server
- `scep` = SCEP
- `snmp` = SNMP server(s)
- `syslog` = Syslog server(s)
- `tacplus` = TACACS+ server
- `uid-`agent = UID agent(s)
- `url-`updates = URL update server
- `vmmonitor` = VM monitor
- `wildfire-`private = WildFire Appliance
- `ztp` = ZTP and Auto-VPN DDNS
- `source` (Attributes) Source (see [below for nested schema](#nestedatt--route--service--source))
- `source_v6` (Attributes) Source v6 (see [below for nested schema](#nestedatt--route--service--source_v6))

<a id="nestedatt--route--service--source"></a>
### Nested Schema for `route.service.source`

Optional:

- `address` (String) Address
- `interface` (String) Interface


<a id="nestedatt--route--service--source_v6"></a>
### Nested Schema for `route.service.source_v6`

- `address` (String) Address

## Import

The following command can be used to import a resource not managed by Terraform:

```bash
terraform import scm_service_route.example folder:::id
```

or

```bash
terraform import scm_service_route.example :snippet::id
```

or

```bash
terraform import scm_service_route.example ::device:id
```

**Note:** Please provide just one of folder, snippet, or device for the import command.
